result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicolas Anton Bastien

defendant.name: Bastien, Nicolas Anton

records.addlTxt:
4:01 PM Apprs: CO: Crt. Commissioner T. Heckmann for S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: S. Bridges. Defendant Nicolas Anton Bastien appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel P Repka appeared by video for Nicolas Anton Bastien.  Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court confirms DE's address. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. DE pleads NG. Bond continues in form and amount. Court approves Zoom appearance for next hearing. Adjourned 4:05 PM
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on December 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:33 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Nicolas Anton Bastien appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel P Repka appeared by video for Nicolas Anton Bastien.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file and notes off record in Chambers conversation that took place yesterday, 10/19/22 with Atty Repka and ADA Damrau. Court moves forward with PH.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. ADA Ellenwood states she will file an information that mirrors the complaint if the Court would like to proceed to ARGN today. Atty Repka does not want to continue to ARGN today.  DE and Atty Repka may appear by zoom for next court date if DE plans to enter NG plea. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 9:41 AM. bph
Arraignment scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Arraignment on November 2, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

3:03 PM Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: K Kittel. Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Daniel P Repka in court for Nicolas Anton Bastien. Atty Repka makes statements, their investigator Tim Brown is not here to testify today, has not been in contact with witness for approximately 2 weeks, and will move for a continuance as to the DE's evidence. S/T Detective Todd Shafer, NRPD; direct by Atty Ellenwood. Record reflects identity of the DE. Cross by Atty Repka. Re-direct by Atty Ellenwood. Re-cross by Atty Repka. Court asks Atty Repka for an offer of proof as to his proposed evidence. Atty Repka responds. Atty Ellenwood responds and asks for bind over. Court makes statements and resets as DE has the right to provide evidence at a PH.  Atty Repka will advise if witness cannot make it, in that event, the Court will issue a written decision. Court confirms address of DE; bond continues. Adjourned: 3:22 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Filed by Atty Repka. arc

- AMENDED

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, with V.A.B or unsupervised contact with minor females except Defendant's minor children with D.A..  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

3:03 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Nicolas Anton Bastien appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel P Repka appeared by video for Nicolas Anton Bastien.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file and motion for bond modification filed by Atty Repka.  Attorney arguments regarding bond. ADA Rockow does not agree with bond motion. Atty Repka states DE's ex- D.A, mother of marital children is on zoom waiting to address bond modification if the Court will allow. Court allows D.A.  to appear by zoom and addresses her in regards to bond request.  D. A. agrees to bond motion.  Court makes statements and finding and modifies bond, Clerk to upload unsigned bond to e-file and Atty Repka to get it to DE to sign it.  Adjourned at 3:19 PM. bph
Filed by Atty repka. arc   to rg
for DE to appear via zoom on 10/3/22. Filed by Atty Repka. arc      Per SRN, Granted. JA advised Atty Repka. arc

8:04 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Nicolas Anton Bastien appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel P Repka in court for Nicolas Anton Bastien.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin with Officer Shafer from NRPD. Set for PH.  Court reviews file and request filed by Atty Repka re: continuance.  Court makes statements in regards to letter filed, Court resets PH. Court reviews process and procedures regarding zoom appearance. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 8:16 AM. bph
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, with V.A.B or unsupervised contact with minor females.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
